result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert D Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
STRAIGHT TIME.
Credit for 2 days if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with
any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No alcohol/drugs.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert D Smith in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Atty. Kuchler to submit a letter with defendant's credit. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
-  9 months jail straight time STAYED for 2 years Probation
-  Fine totaling $969.00 (includes $250.00 DNA Surcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 20 days jail consecutive 
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs. Obtain GED or HSD.   Submit to a formal AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 20, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Robert D Smith in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date in August.  Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Robert D Smith in court with attorney Donna J Kuchler.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kuchler addresses Discovery and requests one more hearing date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on June 23, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Robert D Smith in court with attorney Christopher P Ehrfurth for Donna Kuchler.  Mary C Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert D Smith in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant to have no contact with the business or any co-actors listed in the complaint.

Defendant Robert D Smith in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.
